cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 275 miles SSW of Nantucket, Massachusetts
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating northeastward, passing southeast of New England tonight and expected to cross over or very near Nova Scotia then into the Gulf of St. Lawrence

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches extend only from parts of Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island and Newfoundland – none along the South Carolina coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Active warnings are confined to eastern Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island, Magdalen Islands and portions of coastal New England; none for the South Carolina coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coastline from northern Florida through North Carolina experienced earlier impacts; current impact zone has shifted to New England and Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.wind: No additional strong winds expected; Dorian’s wind field now well northeast of South Carolina
weather_observation.storm_surge: None forecast for Charleston as water levels along the U.S. Southeast coast are receding
weather_observation.rainfall: None significant expected; heaviest rain is shifting toward New England and Atlantic Canada
